intro: Stolzia peperomioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of small, colorful blossoms. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Stolzia peperomioides is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
